name: politico
text:
The U.S. has more than 3 million confirmed Covid-19 cases, as many states deal with alarming surges. What's next? Stay informed with the most critical coronavirus facts and insight from experts across our global newsroom. Sign up for POLITICO Nightly now.
https://t.co/4vI42TQ6qb https://t.co/0DPwxyAGne

name: politico
text:
A vague sense of parental dread was made palpable with a gut punch today in California.

Gov. Newsom shut down significant parts of the economy (again) and the state's largest school districts, in L.A. and San Diego, said they will not reopen next month
https://t.co/c1ZIkEkjA0

name: politico
text:
Armed with an advantage in the polls, an outsider message and President Trump's endorsement, Tommy Tuberville has spent the past 19 weeks sitting on his lead over Jeff Sessions, as Tuesday's GOP primary runoff for Senate in Alabama finally approaches

https://t.co/nsTHHIQ0do

name: politico
text:
The Trump administration is planning to extend restrictions barring non-essential travel across the Mexican and Canadian borders until at least late August, according to three people familiar with the plans

https://t.co/ah5jR8yS4o

name: politico
text:
Trump has spent the past two weeks demanding — often in all caps on Twitter — that American schools reopen this fall.

But America's biggest school systems are rejecting him across the country. And the president has little power to do anything about it
https://t.co/BrScb1RZck

name: politico
text: The House late Monday night urged the Supreme Court to take its final formal steps to obtain President Trump’s personal financial records https://t.co/LIfmWzKPzm
